repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
When git branch contains `/`, the coverage publish fails. This PR escape the name to replace `/` with escape character (`%2F`).

> [!NOTE] 
> CI/CD seems to pass but I don't know how to verify the uploaded coverage file.

comment_data.body: This script is failry simple and not providing any CLI interface. Since main/the only usage is CI/CD I dont mind much but can be done something more inteligent...

We might get away with a one-liner like this:
```suggestion
            ESCAPED_HEAD=$(python3 -c "import sys; from urllib.parse import quote; print(quote(sys.argv[1]))" "$HEAD")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,8 +51,9 @@ jobs:
       - name: Copy coverage HTML
         run: |
           if [ -d './coverage-report-html' ]; then
+            ESCAPED_HEAD=$(printf "%s" "$HEAD" | python Tools/escape_url.py)

comment_data.body: Hmm I thought the idea is to go with `printf(1)`.  In any case I am 100% fine with this approach - it even simplify the change.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,8 +51,9 @@ jobs:
       - name: Copy coverage HTML
         run: |
           if [ -d './coverage-report-html' ]; then
+            ESCAPED_HEAD=$(printf "%s" "$HEAD" | python Tools/escape_url.py)

commit.message:
Revert "Escape coverage html"

This reverts commit b960e5f4afdce3de5973361ba00f92f911671280.

Avoid using separate python script

Co-authored-by: scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de>
